about_the_game:
In the middle of the South Pacific: modern pirates are making the waterways that are so important for international trade unsafe. In order to deal with this ever-growing threat, a mercenary group called The Pilgrims appears on the scene, earning their money with protection missions and the passing on of expertise.

Their newest member is Eddie Jackson, a former US Navy SEAL whose wife was kidnapped on a cruise ship by unknown assailants. There seems to be no motive for the attack on the ship and no ransom demand has been made. The player takes on the role of Eddie and embarks on a desperate search for his beloved wife. He fights on the side of the Pilgrims against various pirate and terrorist groups that are making the area unsafe.

Little by little, he discovers more and more clues that lead him to his wife and the incredible secret behind her disappearance. The story comes from the pen of experienced designer Matthew Miles Griffiths, who has managed to write a gripping, deep and intriguing story with several storylines.

Features:

• Extensive story, divided into 20 missions

• More than 20 high-tech weapons from all over the world, from grenade launchers to sniper rifles

• Tropical locations with lush vegetation, sensational water effects and countless interaction possibilities interaction possibilities

• 4 completely individual squad members with their own history and weapon specialization, who fight for the player in certain missions

content_descriptors.notes:
Some NPCs wearing revealing outfits very briefly in game cutscenes, during a non strip tease dance. Ingame, for very short amount of time, some NPCs with revealing outfits. There isn't actual nudity, or sexual acts, explicit nor implicit.

Very casual use of alcohol by NPCs during short cutscenes, no other illegal drugs used. 

Standard level of violence for a shooter. Violence isn't copious.
